title: Robert Duvall, ‘Godfather’ and ‘Apocalypse Now’ Actor, Dies at 95
summary: The Oscar winner was known for his ability to disappear into roles, playing a wide range of characters in films such as “Apocalypse Now” and “The Godfather,” and in the television series “Lonesome Dove.”

title: Despite Epstein’s Toxicity, Steve Bannon Stood by Him, Texts Indicate
summary: Mr. Bannon, a MAGA podcaster, developed a seemingly chummy relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, who was accused of sex trafficking. He said it was in the name of getting Mr. Epstein to open up.

title: Columbia Punishes 2 Who Helped Epstein’s Girlfriend Enter Dental College
summary: The release of documents tied to Jeffrey Epstein has sent ripples through the worlds of business, politics and academia, including at Columbia, where he helped his girlfriend gain entry.

title: Epstein’s Ties With Academics Show the Seedy Side of College Fund-Raising
summary: Professors and presidents are often eager to raise outside cash. Some are now facing blowback after connecting with Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Epstein Files Hint at His Ties to the Supermodel Naomi Campbell
summary: Ms. Campbell previously claimed she was an acquaintance of the convicted sex offender. Emails shed new light on the extent of their interactions.

title: The Quiet Architect of Trump’s Global Trade War
summary: Jamieson Greer, a low-key lawyer from a working-class background, is rewriting the rules of the global economy at the president’s behest.

title: With Latest Rollback, the U.S. Essentially Has No Clean-Car Rules
summary: The E.P.A.’s killing of the “endangerment finding” caps a year of deregulation that is likely to make cars thirstier for gas and less competitive globally, experts say.

title: From One President to Another, a Love Letter With an Edge
summary: To open a series of essays about U.S. presidents, George W. Bush pays tribute to George Washington, who “ensured America wouldn’t become a monarchy, or worse.”

title: Iran’s Protests Have Ended, but the Anger and Pain Haven’t
summary: In the aftermath of another wave of antigovernment unrest, Iran is gripped by a mood of collective grief and uncertainty about the future.

title: Iran Holds Exercises in Strait of Hormuz After Trump Threatens Military Action
summary: The day before nuclear talks were set to resume, Iran conducted live drills in the Strait of Hormuz, a strategic waterway for oil and gas shipments.

title: How the H-1B Visa Debate Is Driving a Wave of Racism Against South Asians
summary: A dispute over the impact of H-1B visas on U.S. workers has been overshadowed by racist rhetoric, with troubling echoes of the great replacement conspiracy theory.

title: How Spain Is Carving a Different Path on Immigration
summary: The country is hoping its new amnesty for undocumented immigrants will avoid a public backlash.

title: Kansas Town Supports Mayor Charged With Voting Illegally
summary: The Mexican-born mayor of Coldwater was accused of voting illegally as a noncitizen. Many of his neighbors want state and federal officials to back off.

title: Ticket Scam Cost the Louvre $12 Million, Investigators Say
summary: The Paris prosecutor’s office said a network involving museum employees and tour guides had been operating for a decade.

title: Why an A.I. Video of Tom Cruise Battling Brad Pitt Spooked Hollywood
summary: A 15-second clip created by an artificial intelligence tool owned by the Chinese technology company ByteDance appears more cinematic than anything so far.

title: In First Months as Governor, Abigail Spanberger Kicks Up Heat From the Right
summary: The new governor of Virginia, who ran as a centrist Democrat and a former intelligence officer, says the attacks are a sign of her success.

title: Syrian Army Crosses New Threshold With Advances in Kurdish Regions
summary: The advance of the Syrian Army into Kurdish regions could put nearly all the country under one authority. But it ends a dream of autonomy for ethnic Kurds.

title: Indonesia Says It’s Preparing Thousands of Peacekeeping Troops for Trump’s Gaza Plan
summary: President Prabowo Subianto of Indonesia will be among those meeting with President Trump in Washington this week to discuss his Board of Peace initiative to oversee a cease-fire in Gaza.

title: A Russian ‘Village of Military Valor’ Waits for Its Reward
summary: Sedanka has only 250 residents, but dozens of its men left for the front. It is wondering whether recognition that the government promised will ever arrive.

title: 5 New Dumpling Recipes for Lunar New Year 2026
summary: Our annual tribute to one of everyone’s favorite foods returns, with all-new ways to get you pinching and pleating.

title: How to Host an Unforgettable Dumpling Party
summary: Four expert tips turn prep work into a major part of the fun.

title: Trump Risks Igniting a Nuclear Wildfire
summary: The president’s approach to the rising nuclear danger is alarming.

title: What Does Body Positivity Mean in This New Weight Loss Era?
summary: Can you love your body and still want to lose weight?

title: Trial Begins for Father of Teen Charged in Georgia School Shooting
summary: Prosecutors say Colin Gray is criminally culpable after his teenage son killed two students and two teachers with a rifle that had been a Christmas gift.

title: How a Trump Tax Break Rescued Horse Racing
summary: Owners spent nearly $1.5 billion last year on racehorses, a big increase over 2024. A new tax provision allows them to immediately deduct the full cost of the purchase.

title: New York Needs Lifeguards. Would These Teens Make the Cut?
summary: To qualify for a job patrolling the city’s beaches and pools, candidates must swim 50 yards in 50 seconds or less.

title: Dana Eden, Co-Creator of ‘Tehran,’ Dies During Filming of Fourth Season
summary: Ms. Eden, 52, who was also an executive producer of the Emmy-winning show, was found in a hotel room in Athens. Greek police said they did not suspect foul play.
